alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL DUBOIS... NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of English, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Paoli, English, Ellsworth, Greenbrier, Wickliffe, Ethel, Fargo, Taswell and Youngs Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central Indiana.
